results.title: Another little drink
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Opens with groups of people enjoying a social evening in a pub and using alcohol sensibly. An animated sequence follows which corrects commonly held misconceptions about alcohol and details its effects on the brain and the senses. The work of a hospital Alcoholism Treatment Unit is detailed and a psychiatrist explains the stages in the treatment of alcoholics admitted to the Unit and we look in on a group undergoing treatment. The important role of organisations such as Alcoholics Anonymous and regional councils on alcoholism is stressed.

results.title: Caring for the mind
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Details some of the stresses, strains and speed of modern living which have made mental illness a common occurrence. Types of treatment and care of the mentally ill are explained.

results.title: Horatio Nelson and the Battle of Trafalgar
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Nelson is considered Britain’s greatest naval hero. Throughout his early career, he was considered insuboridinate and reckless, but the genius of his miltitary leadership ensured him a place in history. His battles against rival European fleets were unparalleled successes. At the Battle of Trafalgar, Nelson ensured that Britain had mastery of the seas which brought about the subsequent expansion of the British Empire.

results.title: The Great commanders
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description: A six part series which looks at six individuals considered to be military giants. Their motivation and the qualities which made them great commanders are analysed by experts. 3D computer animation is used to illustrate each commander’s particular skill in battle. Each program takes as its focus a key battle which examines the nature of each individual’s military command.

results.title: Islam
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
Like Christianity, Islam is winning converts, particularly in North Africa. This film explores the faith of the Muslims, taking you to Mecca, birthplace of the Prophet Mohamed, and to the shrine of Islam’s holy of holies, the Ka’aba, or Cube. Following the routes of Muslim conquest, you see shrines of holy men and heroes from Cairo to Pakistan. Wherever you go in this vast empire, the power of Islam is apparent in soaring domes and noble architecture of great cities. Against this background the film relates the history of Mohamed and his rise to leadership, spiritual and temporal. Narrated by Douglas Rain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Napoleon Bonaparte and the Battle of Austerlitz
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Napoleon remains one of the most enigmatic and skillful military leaders the world has ever seen. Exploiting the turmoil of the French Revolution, Napoleon was able to eventually become Emperor of France and then set his sights towards the rest of Europe. At the Battle of Austerlitz, Napoleon was able to command a victory against Austria and Russia.

results.title: Hinduism
results.creator_credit: David Millar, James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great Religions”.
In India, the home of most present adherents, this film traces the history of Hinduism, its evolution over the centuries and its connections to Buddhism and Jainism. Shown are the observances of this faith, its teaching of non-violence, its respect for all living things, how the social order created by it has been modified in the modern world to outlaw the declaration of individuals as “untouchables” and to remove limitations on freedom imposed by caste.

results.title: The Drug takers
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
A study of drug misuse among the young people of a typical urban area. Considers the social acceptability and medical uses of certain types of drugs and the effects of some drugs on the workings of the body. An ex-addict discusses his experiences. Finally a psychiatrist warns of the dangers inherent in casual experimentation.
